attributes.comment:
We are a Pennsylvania couple in the process of adopting a child from China. We
are asking for The US Citizenship and Immigration Services Docket ID USCIS-2006-
0044 not be brought into effect.
We have completed the necessary forms and paid the appropriate fees without
complaint as we realize that paperwork and processing takes money and our child is
surely worth this. That said, I do not feel that it is neither necessary nor fair to
increase the cost of this paperwork 66%. Adoption is expensive enough already, and it
is unconscionable to raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions. Couples
undertaking this momentous journey have usually undergone tremendous family
planning expenditures prior to adoption and will have to pay for the adoption and travel.
Increasing the cost of adoption-related petitions may take the dream of a family out of
reach for deserving couples.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anonymous
